about_the_game:
Welcome to Macungie, Pennsylvania!

The Lockridge Shipping Company, a once bustling hub of commerce, now stands as a relic of the prosperity once experienced by a small community. Andrew Allen, the company’s latest hire, seizes this opportunity to weave digital threads through the decaying fabric of tradition, bringing the company into the modern era with his expertise in data security. Unknown to him, the company’s purpose has shifted, veering away from its repetitive logistical operations. His employee orientation, a mundane affair on paper, unfolds like a cryptic ritual with the intention of summoning a cataclysmic merger of worlds. As time runs out, Andrew finds himself entangled in the past, present, and future. Only you will decide how it ends.

Gameplay Features Summary

Maguntsche: Chapter Two is an indie horror game that blends the traditional elements of the survival horror genre with a branching narrative experience. The player is tasks with exploring the Lockridge Shipping Company Industrial Complex and must search for items to enable their progression through the warehouse.

Additionally, the player will be tasked with completing mini-games and will have the ability to collect, store, and craft useful items to help them in direct encounters with the entities of the Realmverse. During these frightening encounters, the player will experience two realms stitched together, where a mirrored reality hides in plain sight and the rules are changed.

When immersed within the Realmverse, the player must collect reality fragments to return to their body and continue their investigation; finding a way to stop these otherworldly forces. The Lockridge Industrial Complex is a vast facility full of hidden secrets. Look carefully and you might find evidence and other documents that provides additional insights into the secrets of your new employer. The further you dig, the closer you become to the truth.

content_descriptors.notes: Maguntsche: Chapter Two is a survival horror game with elements including violence and gore. The game also contains general mature content not suitable for all audiences.

short_description: A programmer returns to his hometown as a new employee for a local shipping company. His orientation, a mundane affair, unfolds like a cryptic ritual with the intention of summoning a cataclysmic merger of worlds. As time runs out, Andrew finds himself entangled in the past, present, and future.
